title: Quasitoric manifold
summary: In mathematics, a quasitoric manifold is a topological analogue of the nonsingular projective toric variety of algebraic geometry. A smooth 2 n {\displaystyle 2n} -dimensional manifold is a quasitoric manifold if it admits a smooth, locally standard action of an n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional torus, with orbit space an n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional simple convex polytope.
